t: Hear*p my prayer, O Lord,*s give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.
And*p enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.
For*p the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
Therefore*p is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.
I*p remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.
I*p stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.
Hear*p me speedily, O Lord:*s my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.
Cause*p me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.
Deliver*p me, O Lord,*s from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.
Teach*p me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.
Quicken*p me, O Lord,*s for thy name's sake: for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.
And*p of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.
